page.title: 13CROY VILLAGE
page.content: Croy Village stands eight to nine miles from the town of Inverness.In the village there is a public post office and food shop,which is open everyday of the week except Sundays.Local buses run through Croy going to Inverness and Nairn.A church also stands in Croy and in its grounds is a watch tower which was used many many years ago to watch out for body snatchers.There is also a school which teaches children age five to twelve.From Croy you can see the various and beautiful views over looking the Moray Firth to the Black Isle area.Further out you can see Ben Wyvis as well as the other mountains surrounding it.
